entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs FlyOne airline launches flights to Beirut

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs FlyOne airline launches flights to Beirut
media:group.media:description:
üìåEU Special Representative to the South Caucasus Toivo Klaar has been criticized after welcoming Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev‚Äôs speech, which included threats against Armenia. üìåThe ruling Civil Contract party has nominated Anna Vardapetyan, Pashinyan‚Äôs assistant, to the post of Prosecutor General. üìåArmenian private airline FlyOne Armenia has launched direct flights between Yerevan and Beirut.

entry.title: Are investors being put off by Armenia‚Äôs geopolitical situation?

media:group.media:title: Are investors being put off by Armenia‚Äôs geopolitical situation?
media:group.media:description:
Patrick Elliott, the co-founder and regional director of IBCCS Tax Armenia, talks to CivilNet about Armenia‚Äôs investment climate and whether foreign businesses are discouraged from investing due to the country‚Äôs unstable geopolitical situation. Elliott also discusses how IBCCS Tax Armenia assists investors opening businesses in the country and why the recent influx of Russians presents a unique economic opportunity.

entry.title: Artsakh will never be part of Azerbaijan, reiterates Karabakh‚Äôs foreign minister

media:group.media:title: Artsakh will never be part of Azerbaijan, reiterates Karabakh‚Äôs foreign minister
media:group.media:description:
During a June 20 press conference, Foreign Minister of Artsakh Davit Babayan responded to a CivilNet question regarding the issue of the status of Artsakh. Babayan explained that Stepanakert wants an extension of the mandate of the Russian peacekeeping contingent in Karabakh, which is set to expire in 2025.

entry.title: Yerevan students win chance to send device into space

media:group.media:title: Yerevan students win chance to send device into space
media:group.media:description:
At Yerevan‚Äôs AYB school, a group of students won the 2022 Kemurjyan Universal Space Competition, allowing them the opportunity to design a device that will be sent into space. The device will reach an altitude of over 125 kilometres and will collect data regarding speed, pressure changes, temperatures, ultraviolet radiation and ozone concentrations. The launch of the device by a rocket is expected to happen later this year.

entry.title: Russia concedes it failed to prevent Azerbaijan‚Äôs advance in Karabakh‚Äôs Parukh, says Armenian presid

media:group.media:title: Russia concedes it failed to prevent Azerbaijan‚Äôs advance in Karabakh‚Äôs Parukh, says Armenian presid
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe Russian government privately conceded it made an ‚Äúoversight‚Äù by allowing Azerbaijani troops to advance their positions towards Karabakh‚Äôs Parukh village, says Armenian President Vahagn Khachatryan. üìçThe Armenian Foreign Ministry denies claims by Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev that Armenia rejected an offer to hold a trilateral meeting in Tbilisi among the foreign ministers of Armenia, Azerbaijan and Georgia. üìçArmenia‚Äôs annual economic growth has risen to 8.8% in April, according to the World Bank.

entry.title: Unpacking the challenges facing Armenia‚Äôs growing IT sector

media:group.media:title: Unpacking the challenges facing Armenia‚Äôs growing IT sector
media:group.media:description:
Tigran Sloyan, the CEO and co-founder of tech company Codesignal, talks to CivilNet about Armenia‚Äôs growing IT sector and the challenges tech companies face, like inadequate education and the lack of a qualified workforce. Mr. Sloyan also discusses what other countries like Israel have done in order to help grow their own IT sectors.
